llm_response.description: The image shows extensive retinal hemorrhages, with a significant number of red blood cells present throughout the fundus. There are also signs of cotton wool spots and possibly some microaneurysms. The overall appearance suggests a high level of retinal vascular damage.

The image shows signs of diabetic retinopathy. There are several hemorrhages present, some appearing as small dots and others as larger, more confluent areas. There are also some cotton wool spots visible, which are indicative of nerve fiber layer infarcts. The retinal vessels appear somewhat irregular and congested. The optic disc appears normal.
